item.title: Investors are looking at bargains in China, says HSBC investment boss, pushed by AI discounts and fears over Trump 2.0
item.description: HSBC's Willem Sels tells Fortune in an exclusive interview that while U.S. markets remain resilient, geopolitical uncertainty is pushing investors to ...

item.title: Trump fires CDC head after one month on the job. Her lawyers say she ‘refused to rubber-stamp unscientific, reckless directives’
item.description: Susan Monarez's departure coincided with the resignations this week of at least four top CDC officials.

item.title: Exclusive: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz on $290 million acquisition of startup Onum and security in the AI age
item.description: The cybersecurity company, which went public in 2019, is a longtime acquirer, and has acquired data observability startup Onum for about $290 million.

item.title: YouTube TV reaches ‘short-term extension’ to keep Fox channels on platform
item.description: In a statement earlier Wednesday, Fox said that it was “disappointed that Google continually exploits its outsized influence."

item.title: Target still facing boycott from pro-DEI activists: ‘Leadership change doesn’t mean anything without a culture change’
item.description: The number of Americans who say they regularly shop at Target has gone down 19% since 2021, according to GWI, with Democrats the majority.
